mapper.select: SELECT m.id as id,g.name as gname,m.title as title, m.director as director, m.mainactor as mainactor, m.releasedate as releasedate, m.posterimg1 as posterimg1,m.posterimg2 as posterimg2, m.country as country, m.runningtime as runningtime, m.text as text, COUNT(r.id) as rcnt,ROUND(AVG(r.star),1) as star FROM movie m INNER JOIN genre g ON g.id = m.gid INNER JOIN reviews r ON r.mid=m.id GROUP BY id HAVING id = #{id}

SELECT m.id as id,g.name as gname,m.title as title, m.director as director, m.mainactor as mainactor, m.releasedate as releasedate, m.posterimg1 as posterimg1,m.posterimg2 as posterimg2, m.country as country, m.runningtime as runningtime, m.text as text, COUNT(r.id) as rcnt,ROUND(AVG(r.star),1) as star FROM movie m INNER JOIN genre g ON g.id = m.gid INNER JOIN reviews r ON r.mid=m.id GROUP BY id

SELECT m.id as id,g.name as gname,m.title as title, m.director as director, m.mainactor as mainactor, m.releasedate as releasedate, m.posterimg1 as posterimg1,m.posterimg2 as posterimg2, m.country as country, m.runningtime as runningtime, m.text as text, COUNT(r.id) as rcnt,ROUND(AVG(r.star),1) as star FROM movie m INNER JOIN genre g ON g.id = m.gid INNER JOIN reviews r ON r.mid=m.id where m.id BETWEEN #{id} and (#{id}+2) GROUP BY id

SELECT m.id, m.gid, m.title, m.director, m.mainactor, m.releasedate, m.posterimg1, m.posterimg2, m.country, m.runningtime, m.text, g.name as gname, g.tid as hgid, ROUND(AVG(r.star),1) as star, COUNT(mid) as rcnt FROM movie m INNER JOIN genre g ON m.gid=g.id INNER JOIN reviews r ON r.mid=m.id
g.name LIKE CONCAT('%',#{searchtxt},'%')
m.mainactor LIKE CONCAT('%',#{searchtxt},'%')
m.director LIKE CONCAT('%',#{searchtxt},'%')
m.country LIKE CONCAT('%',#{searchtxt},'%')
GROUP BY id;

SELECT m.id, m.gid, m.title, m.director, m.mainactor, m.releasedate, m.posterimg1, m.posterimg2, m.country, m.runningtime, m.text, g.name as gname, g.tid as hgid, ROUND(AVG(r.star),1) as star ,COUNT(mid) as rcnt FROM movie m INNER JOIN genre g ON m.gid=g.id INNER JOIN reviews r ON r.mid=m.id GROUP BY id ORDER BY star DESC LIMIT 0, 6

SELECT m.id, m.gid, m.title, m.director, m.mainactor, m.releasedate, m.posterimg1, m.posterimg2, m.country, m.runningtime, m.text, g.name as gname, g.tid as hgid, ROUND(AVG(r.star),1) as star, s.id as sid, s.sdate as sdate FROM movie m INNER JOIN schedules s ON s.mid=m.id INNER JOIN genre g ON m.gid=g.id INNER JOIN reviews r ON r.mid=m.id WHERE s.sdate = DATE_FORMAT(sysdate(), '%Y-%m-%d') GROUP BY m.id

SELECT m.id, m.gid, m.title, m.director, m.mainactor, m.releasedate, m.posterimg1, m.posterimg2, m.country, m.runningtime, m.text, g.name as gname, g.tid as hgid, ROUND(AVG(r.star),1) as star ,COUNT(mid) as rcnt FROM movie m INNER JOIN genre g ON m.gid=g.id INNER JOIN reviews r ON r.mid=m.id GROUP BY id ORDER BY star DESC LIMIT #{mnum1},#{mnum2}
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM ( SELECT m.id, ROUND(AVG(r.star),1) as star FROM movie m INNER JOIN reviews r ON r.mid=m.id GROUP BY id) c

SELECT m.id as id, s.id as sid,s.tid as tid,s.sdate as sdate, ds.starttime as starttime, ds.endtime as endtime FROM movie m INNER JOIN schedules s ON s.mid=m.id INNER JOIN detail_schedules ds ON ds.sid = s.id
